content_summary: Michael Levin discusses the concept of bioelectricity, comparing it to the cognitive glue that binds neurons together and allows cells to form a collective with shared memory. He mentions the use of voltage sensitive fluorescent dyes to track electrical communication in a frog embryo, and the development of simulation tools to explore memory networks and pattern completion.
